topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Elena frames growth as a young, hype-driven field full of out-of-context “growth hacks,” leading to churn in growth roles and widespread misunderstanding of what growth teams can actually do.

topics.title: Mistake #1: Hiring growth too early
topics.summary: Elena argues founders must drive early growth until there’s real PMF and enough data volume to run experiments; hiring growth before that is outsourcing the hardest founder job and sets everyone up to fail.

topics.title: Growth vs sales: when to hire which
topics.summary: They distinguish sales-led vs product-led motions: if sales is the monetization engine, hire sales before growth; if product drives acquisition/activation/monetization, growth may come earlier.

topics.title: Mistake #2: Hiring growth to reverse decline
topics.summary: Elena warns that when the core business is slowing, a new head of growth can’t create a miracle re-acceleration; first address core product/PMF or GTM issues and at least stop the decline.

topics.title: Mistake #3: Rebrand/redesign as growth lever
topics.summary: They discuss how homepage/marketing-site redesigns usually hurt performance at launch and require months of post-launch optimization; rebrands can be strategic, but shouldn’t be promised as immediate growth drivers.

topics.title: Mistake #4: Copying competitors and benchmarks
topics.summary: Elena advocates using competitors for inspiration and pattern-spotting, not direct copying; she also cautions that benchmarks are often misleading due to inconsistent metric definitions and contexts.

topics.title: Mistake #5: Treating problems as unique
topics.summary: Elena argues most growth problems have precedents; teams should avoid reinventing solutions, talk to people who’ve solved similar issues, and build reusable patterns/frameworks to move faster.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsored segment featuring OneSchema and its File Feeds product for building and maintaining reliable CSV-based integrations with validation and alerting.

topics.title: Recap of mistakes #1–#5
topics.summary: Lenny summarizes the first five “never works” tactics: hiring growth too early, hiring growth to fix decline, expecting redesigns to drive growth, copying competitors, and reinventing common solutions.

topics.title: Mistake #6: Growth teams over-focus on paid/SEO
topics.summary: Elena argues growth should prioritize building “earned” channels (virality, referrals, UGC/community) that the company owns, rather than relying primarily on algorithm-driven channels like SEO/SEM and paid social.
